page.title: 01Brereton in the Eighties.
page.content: Brereton is situated two miles south of Holmes Chapel, sitting astride the A50 which journeys between Manchester and Newcastle under Lyme. " Bretune" as Brereton was called in the original Domesday Book, the name was thought to have originated from Brittany Brereton is a{rural area}surrounded by fields,it is a very flat area and is part of the Cheshire Plain. Most of its{population}live centred around the estate locally called "the Crescent" The remainder of the people are scattered around the many country lanes in the area,these mainly comprising of farms or of renovated farm property now used solely for domestic use.
